title: Ticket #6545: Test GPUsUsage and company with dynamic slots.
description: The tests committed in #6477 and desired in #6543 and #6544 are not run against partitionable slots in the test suite. They need to be.
remarks:
2018-Feb-09 09:52:50 by tlmiller:
The commits from Feb 7 run the tests from #6477 against dynamic slots.

The tests from #6543 and #6544 may or may not automatically benefit from this work, depending on how they're implemented.

There's some additional work to do to improve testing accuracy as a result of this ticket: if the startd's debug flag includes D_TEST, it should include the sample duration used to compute the usage in each .update.ad write. The test should report this information to assist in debugging, printing a warning if it's not the expected duration. (The test may even be able to check if the resulting usage is as would be expected, but since anomalous lengths may also result in extra samples being aggregated, this could be tricky.)

2018-Feb-09 14:12:46 by tlmiller:
Bugs:

  1. So it turns out that if you duplicate two different tests, the outputs and logs of their jobs get interleaved. This causes problems when you check how much output there was. (While I'm fixing this, I should probably also try to fix the occasional line miscount problem, assuming that it's causes by job outputs stepping on each other.)

  2. Also, if you round in the event log, my test will flag that as an error, because the value in the event log doesn't match the value in condor_history.

2018-Feb-19 15:06:07 by tlmiller:
Infrastructure for static vs dynamic slots is now in place, so I'm making a note of this requirement in the other testing tickets and resolving this one.
